comment.body: A cryptographic hash is a one-way function meaning that it cannot be reversed. But there exist databases that store all inputs and outputs, and if that database happens to have an output with the corresponding input then you can get the password back.

Are you trying to derive a password from some input? Then I'd suggest hashing not encrypting.
Something like `echo "mypassword@zeronet" | sha256sum | head -c 16` 

"head -c 16" is optional, to make it a bit shorter, can be 16 chars or whatever you wish.

Or in python:

`python -c 'from hashlib import sha256; print(sha256("mypassword@zeronet").hexdigest()[:16])'`

Scrypt is even better:

https://zh.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scrypt

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scrypt
No, looks fun though. But I don't have a smartphone :-)
You've succesfully edited your data.json file! Congratulations
